title: What Jabrill Peppers said about his surprising release from the Patriots
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jabrill Peppers was released by the New England Patriots on cutdown day after signing an extension last year.
Peppers joined the Pittsburgh Steelers, expressing happiness about playing for coach Mike Tomlin sooner than expected.
Peppers must quickly learn Pittsburgh's defensive scheme to contribute effectively; he missed most of last season due to trial issues.

title: Mark Wahlberg is filming a new movie on the North Shore
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Mark Wahlberg is filming 'Weekend Warriors' in Lynn, Massachusetts, co-produced by LeBron James for Apple TV+.
'Weekend Warriors' is directed by Stephen Chbosky and follows a father-son duo traveling to see NBA games.
Filming is expected to continue in the North Shore area through October, per NBC Boston.

title: What’s the deal with this art installation near South Station made entirely of coolers?
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: The art installation 'Elevar La Cultura' near South Station is made of gold-spray-painted Coleman coolers and reflects immigrant experiences.
Created by artist Victor 'Marka27' Quiñonez, it challenges U.S. immigration policies with symbolic elements like 'ICE' references.
The installation will be in Boston until December before moving to sanctuary cities across the U.S., as per the artist's website.

title: FBI releases photos of person of interest in Charlie Kirk’s assassination
author: The Associated Press
bullets: The FBI released photos of a person of interest in Charlie Kirk's assassination, showing them wearing a hat, sunglasses, and a long-sleeve black shirt.
The sniper is believed to have fired one shot from a rooftop at Utah Valley University using a Mauser .30 caliber rifle, then fled the scene.
Charlie Kirk was speaking at an event on gun violence when he was shot, drawing bipartisan condemnation and praise from Donald Trump.

title: Paul Pierce said Jayson Tatum’s injury ‘made it easier’ for Celtics to move Holiday, Porzingis
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Paul Pierce stated Jayson Tatum's injury facilitated Celtics' decision to trade Jrue Holiday and Kristaps Porzingis.
The trades were driven by financial constraints, avoiding further penalties from the NBA's luxury tax second apron threshold.
Celtics' roster changes leave them ranked 12th in the Eastern Conference, awaiting Tatum's return for season improvement.

title: MassGOP to pay $36K after allegations of illegal donations
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Massachusetts Republican Party to pay over $36,000 for alleged illegal donations from 2022, including one from former politician Dean Tran.
Dean Tran, serving prison for fraud, made the largest donation of $27,723.45 from his federal congressional campaign account.
Current MassGOP leaders, under Amy Carnevale, cooperated with the investigation and blamed 'sloppy accounting' for the mistakes.

title: 2 mountain towns in New England are affordable and ‘full of adventure’ this winter
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: North Conway, NH, and Ludlow, VT, are named affordable winter destinations by TravelAwaits.
North Conway offers over 1,600 skiable acres with activities like snowshoeing and cross-country skiing.
Ludlow features Okemo Mountain Resort, a tubing park, and winter trails around Okemo Valley.

title: Officials: Charlie Kirk’s killer blended in on campus; high-powered rifle recovered
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Charlie Kirk was assassinated by a sniper at Utah Valley University; shooter is unidentified, weapon recovered.
The shooter blended in with campus, and Kirk's death is being treated as a political assassination.
Utah Governor Spencer Cox and others condemned the political violence; Charlie Kirk praised posthumously by political figures.

title: ‘Laughable’: College football analyst’s blunt take on Bill Belichick’s start at UNC
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Bill Belichick's start as head coach at UNC began with a 48-14 loss to TCU.
Belichick banned New England Patriots scouts from UNC, calling it a reciprocal decision.
ESPN's Paul Finebaum criticized Belichick's decisions and early performance at UNC on 'The Rich Eisen Show.'

title: This Mass. woman just placed 2nd on NBC’s ‘American Ninja Warrior’
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Massachusetts native Addy Herman placed 2nd in NBC's 2025 'American Ninja Warrior: Women's Championship'.
Herman's boyfriend, Noah Meunier from Fairhaven, also placed 2nd on the overall show in the same season.
Both train at Fall River's Vitality Obstacle Fitness and have set a mixed pair obstacle course world record.
